_comment: ADVANCED 'QUASI-YOLO' SETTINGS — For experienced Claude Code users.
_comment2: Most operations are auto-approved. Only destructive or irreversible operations require explicit consent.
_comment3: DO NOT start here. Use settings-starter.json first and migrate once you trust Claude's judgment.

permissions._allow_comment: These patterns are auto-approved without prompting.
permissions._ask_comment: These patterns ALWAYS require explicit user consent regardless of the allow list above.
permissions._ask_comment2: The ask list takes precedence over the allow list.

_model_comment: DEFAULT: claude-sonnet-4-6 — use for all routine tasks (Terraform, debugging, MRs, etc.).
_model_comment2: claude-opus-4-6 is significantly more expensive. Only switch when Sonnet is genuinely
_model_comment3: insufficient: large architecture work, complex multi-system debugging. Not for everyday use.
_model_comment4: Override per-session without changing this file: claude --model claude-opus-4-6
_model_comment5: Formal governance (rate limits, token budgets) is coming. Use responsibly in the interim.
_hooks_comment: Hooks run before or after tool calls. This example blocks edits to generated/managed files.

hooks.command: case "$CLAUDE_FILE_PATH" in *.lock.hcl|*-providers.tf|*.auto.tfvars.json) echo 'BLOCK: This file is generated/managed externally. Do not edit directly.' >&2; exit 2;; esac

_auto_memory_comment: CLAUDE_CODE_DISABLE_AUTO_MEMORY=0 ENABLES auto memory (retains context across sessions).
_auto_memory_comment2: Set to '1' to disable. Most users should leave it at 0.
_plugins_comment: Plugins extend Claude Code with team-specific slash commands and skills.
_plugins_comment3: Install plugins via /plugins in a Claude Code session, then add the entry here.
